verses.text: \w Now|strong="H3478"\w* \w these|strong="H3605"\w* \w are|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w land|strong="H5676"\w* whom \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Israelites|strong="H3478"\w* \w struck|strong="H5221"\w* \w down|strong="H5221"\w* \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w whose|strong="H1121"\w* lands \w they|strong="H5704"\w* \w took|strong="H3423"\w* \w beyond|strong="H5676"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w* \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w east|strong="H4217"\w*, \w from|strong="H3478"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* Arnon \w Valley|strong="H5158"\w* \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w Mount|strong="H2022"\w* \w Hermon|strong="H2768"\w*, \w including|strong="H5704"\w* \w all|strong="H3605"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Arabah|strong="H6160"\w* \w eastward|strong="H4217"\w*:

Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon. He ruled from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Valley, along the middle of the valley, up to the Jabbok River (the border of the Ammonites), that is, half of Gilead,

as well as the Arabah east of the Sea of Chinnereth \f + \fr 12:3 \ft That is, the Sea of Galilee\f* to the Sea of the Arabah (the Salt Sea \f + \fr 12:3 \ft That is, the Dead Sea\f*), eastward through Beth-jeshimoth, and southward below the slopes of Pisgah.
And Og king of Bashan,\f + \fr 12:4 \ft LXX; Hebrew And the territory of Og king of Bashan\f* one of the remnant of the Rephaim, who lived in Ashtaroth and Edrei.
He ruled over Mount Hermon, Salecah, all of Bashan up to the border of the Geshurites and Maacathites, and half of Gilead to the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.

\w Moses|strong="H4872"\w*, \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w*, \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w Israelites|strong="H3478"\w* \w had|strong="H3068"\w* \w struck|strong="H5221"\w* \w them|strong="H5414"\w* \w down|strong="H5221"\w* \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w given|strong="H5414"\w* \w their|strong="H3068"\w* land \w as|strong="H3068"\w* \w an|strong="H5414"\w* \w inheritance|strong="H3425"\w* \w to|strong="H3478"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w Reubenites|strong="H7206"\w*, \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w Gadites|strong="H1425"\w*, \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w half-tribe|strong="H2677"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w*. The Kings Defeated West of the Jordan

\w And|strong="H1121"\w* \w these|strong="H5221"\w* \w are|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w land|strong="H5676"\w* \w that|strong="H3478"\w* \w Joshua|strong="H3091"\w* \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w Israelites|strong="H3478"\w* \w conquered|strong="H5221"\w* \w beyond|strong="H5676"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w* \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w west|strong="H3220"\w*, \w from|strong="H5927"\w* \w Baal-gad|strong="H1171"\w* \w in|strong="H3478"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w Valley|strong="H1237"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Lebanon|strong="H3844"\w* \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w Mount|strong="H2022"\w* \w Halak|strong="H2510"\w*, \w which|strong="H3478"\w* \w rises|strong="H5927"\w* \w toward|strong="H5927"\w* \w Seir|strong="H8165"\w* (according \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* allotments \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w tribes|strong="H7626"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, \w Joshua|strong="H3091"\w* \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* \w them|strong="H5414"\w* \w as|strong="H5704"\w* \w an|strong="H5414"\w* \w inheritance|strong="H3425"\w*

\w the|strong="H2022"\w* \w hill|strong="H2022"\w* \w country|strong="H2022"\w*, \w the|strong="H2022"\w* \w foothills|strong="H8219"\w*,\f + \fr 12:8 \ft Hebrew Shephelah or lowlands; that is, the western foothills of Judea\f* \w the|strong="H2022"\w* \w Arabah|strong="H6160"\w*, \w the|strong="H2022"\w* slopes, \w the|strong="H2022"\w* \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*, \w and|strong="H2022"\w* \w the|strong="H2022"\w* \w Negev|strong="H5045"\w*â€”\w the|strong="H2022"\w* lands \w of|strong="H2022"\w* \w the|strong="H2022"\w* \w Hittites|strong="H2850"\w*, Amorites, \w Canaanites|strong="H3669"\w*, \w Perizzites|strong="H6522"\w*, \w Hivites|strong="H2340"\w*, \w and|strong="H2022"\w* \w Jebusites|strong="H2983"\w*):
the king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which is near Bethel, one;
the king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;
the king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;
the king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;
the king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;
the king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;
the king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;
the king of Makkedah, one; the king of Bethel, one;
the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;
the king of Aphek, one; the king of Lasharon, one;
the king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;
the king of Shimron-meron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;
the king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;
the king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;

the king of Dor in Naphath-dor,\f + \fr 12:23 \ft Or in the heights of Dor; Naphath-dor is a variant of Naphoth-dor; see Joshua 11:2.\f* one; the king of Goiim in Gilgal,\f + \fr 12:23 \ft Hebrew; LXX Goyim in Galilee\f* one;
and the king of Tirzah, one. So \w there|strong="H3605"\w* \w were|strong="H4428"\w* \w thirty-one|strong="H7970"\w* \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* \w in|strong="H4428"\w* \w all|strong="H3605"\w*.
